Dear Charo,
Fanwork can be defined any way you want (^_^)
in the past peopl=
e donated notes, artwork (it doesn't matter if it is
AU, roleplays...anythi=
ng!), cosplay photos, fanfic, we also have
original audio fics and short fi=
lms and ofcourse the ever valuable
translations.

The sky is the limit.

In=
 fact there is no need to adhere to any one "universe" such ar
Kenshin or P=
eacemaker---if you have your own interpretation we
certainly want to see it=
.

You can find examples here:

Makoto Multimedia Dojo
http://www.shinsengu=
mihq.com/MFD.htm

Fanart (includes spoofs/parodies)
http://www.shinsengumih=
q.com/art.htm

Cosplay (includes permanent body art like tattoos)
http://ww=
w.shinsengumihq.com/cosplay.htm

Fans are encouraged to define what fanwork=
 means to them so AU is more
than acceptable.  

In fact I really want fans=
 to come up fantasy "book covers" or fantasy
manga covers.  For example dra=
wing out an entire manga and writing it
is very time consuming...however we=
'd like to see what people would
design for their story's cover---and they =
can include a one paragraph
summary of the plot line (Sort of like what wou=
ld go on the back of
the book cover).

Thanks ahead of time for your contri=
bution and participation.
